comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Kingsand Clock Tower, Cornwall (taken from Girt Beach) [http://www.flickr.com/photos/bazrichardson/5506636354/]The clock tower was erected to mark the coronation of King George V in June 1911. It sits atop the Maker with Rame Institute. "In July 1913 drawings for the new building were prepared by the architect, Harold A Hosking. The builder, William Stephens of Millbrook started the rebuilding shortly after. ... The foundation stone was laid ... on Friday, 7 November 1913 at 3.30 pm. .... The construction of the new building was interrupted by World War I and it was five years before it was fully completed although the Clock Tower was finished in 1914. - www.ramehistorygroup.org.uk/local_buildings.html

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content:
Hi Pellethepoet. 
Thanks for identifying the Kingsand Clock Tower. We have updated our museum records accordingly. During their world circumnavigation on yacht SIRIUS, the Nossiters arrived in Plymouth, England on 2 June 1936 and stayed in the UK for three months before sailing out of Cowes, England on 17 September for the return voyage to Australia.
